channel.title: Command for Rune-Evo 742
channel.description:
Hey,
Does someone have a working ::copy command for 718+? I tried to make one myself, but I failed, I deleted code so I cant post it here :/
Greets, MrSettoo

item.title: Command for Rune-Evo 742
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:8, topic:523081”][quote author=xXSh0ckXx link=topic=641597.msg4322088#msg4322088 date=1372346205]
Well mate, Just a hint for your Coding Experience :
If you are a beginner, dont start with a 718 That’s more difficult than (example: PI, Delta or hyperion)

Just a hint, i’m not forcing anyone ! ;D
[/quote]

Now that is just funny, using a different revision doesn’t make it harder to program a server. What makes a server hard to program is how it was constructed. If the server was programmed to have tons of code snippets from hundreds of other people with little to no design then it will be far harder to created well maintainable code in the future. If you design the server well and make it modular you will be able to create content with little worry of breaking other parts of the code base.

EDIT: Since I forgot to add anything for your question, as a suggestion. If you wish to run a server and gain players don’t add commands like ::copy it’s a waste of time and will end up creating more problems for you. But if you wish to have it, please next time do a little googling time instead of just requesting people to do it for you.

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs-503-client-server/help/489755-718-742-copy-command.html

The site is censored on here, but as a hint it’s rune then server.[/quote]

You mis- understood me,
the most higher revision servers are hard constructed. Thats what i mean. Thats why i recommended him going a bit lower. And i do totally agree with you, sorry for explaing it that bad

Read full topic

If you are a beginner, dont start with a 718 That’s more difficult than (example: PI, Delta or hyperion)

Just a hint, i’m not forcing anyone ! ;D[/quote]

Now that is just funny, using a different revision doesn’t make it harder to program a server. What makes a server hard to program is how it was constructed. If the server was programmed to have tons of code snippets from hundreds of other people with little to no design then it will be far harder to created well maintainable code in the future. If you design the server well and make it modular you will be able to create content with little worry of breaking other parts of the code base.

EDIT: Since I forgot to add anything for your question, as a suggestion. item.title: Command for Rune-Evo 742
item.dc:creator: @MrSettoo MrSettoo
item.description:
@MrSettoo wrote:

[quote=“xXSh0ckXx, post:4, topic:523081”][quote author=MrSettoo link=topic=641597.msg4322091#msg4322091 date=1372346986]
I’m not a beginner, but yeah, I think 718 is to high for me.
But I won’t give up, I will finish my server xD

I can always ask for help huh?

Already fixed some bugs in the source, so it ain’t that hard…
[/quote]

Haha Well, im coding since 2009 / 2010, and i still didnt started with any higher revision than 474 It’s not that hard but i feel not ready for this It takes much time, thats why im still working on PI Well goodluck with that, but i recommend you working on a lower revision And of course you can always ask in this section for help, but only server sided

[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,138.0.html]||Client sided help||[/quote]

Well, a Command is server-sided

Read full topic
